items.title: Gemini can now turn your Google Docs into podcasts
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Google introduced new Gemini features for Google Docs, including AI-generated podcasts.
- The podcast feature, which has been available in Google’s NotebookLM and Gemini app, will provide audio overviews in Google Docs and AI narration.
- Another upcoming feature includes an AI suggestion tool to refine document drafts, expected later this quarter.
- Future enhancements for Sheets will include an AI feature to help analyze and visualize data, coming later this year.

items.title: Smart home device manufacturers are bracing for chaos — again
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- President Trump's new tariffs include a 125% levy on Chinese imports, affecting the smart home industry.
- Device manufacturers are already struggling due to previous tariffs, increased competition, and slow demand.
- Companies like iRobot and Brilliant have faced difficulties due to rising tariffs and supply chain challenges.
- Most smart home companies source products from China, complicating manufacturing shifts to other countries like Vietnam.
- New tariffs create uncertainty, making it hard for companies to invest in U.S. factories.
- Higher consumer costs may limit market entry for smart home products, as affordability is a major barrier for potential buyers.
- Price increases for smart home devices are anticipated, impacting purchasing decisions.

items.title: One of our favorite video doorbells is on sale for $80
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- TP-Link’s Tapo D225 Video Doorbell Camera is on sale for $79.99, a $20 discount.
- Features include recording to a microSD, smart alerts for people, pets, and packages, and phone calls when someone presses the doorbell.
- It offers a wide 180-degree field of view and does not require subscription fees, making it a great value below $100.

items.title: Trump announces a ’90-day pause’ on tariffs outside of China
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 90-day pause on certain tariffs and a reduction to 10% for countries not retaliating against US tariffs.
- He raised tariffs on China to 125% in response to their recent tariffs on US goods.
- The new tariff level, if implemented, signifies a substantial decrease for many countries exporting to the US, including Vietnam.

items.title: Teenage Engineering has updated its KO II synthesizer with new sampling powers
items.author: Andrew Liszewski

items.title: The best AirPods to buy
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The article reviews various AirPods models suitable for different preferences, including the AirPods Pro, AirPods 4, and AirPods Max.
- Highlights the features such as noise cancellation, sound quality, and integration with Apple devices.
- Discusses pricing: AirPods Pro at $219, AirPods 4 from $117, and AirPods Max at $500.
- Emphasizes the unique selling points of the AirPods Pro, including health features and precise location tracking.

items.title: WordPress.com is offering a new AI site builder
items.author: Umar Shakir

items.title: The Switch 2's Joy-Con charging grip has two extra buttons
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- The Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip features two extra remappable back buttons (GL and GR).
- Priced at $34.99, it is a cheaper alternative to the $79.99 Pro Controller.
- Scheduled to launch on June 5th alongside the Nintendo Switch 2, which has delayed preorders in the US and Canada.

items.title: You can now give Google's AI video model camera directions
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google introduces new features for its video AI model, Veo 2, allowing users to create cinematic footage and edit real videos.
- New capabilities include inpainting for removing unwanted backgrounds and outpainting to extend video frames with AI-generated content.
- Cinematic technique presets have been added to guide shot composition, camera angles, and pacing.
- An interpolation feature allows transitions between still images, enhancing video continuity.
- Veo 2's updates aim to compete with Adobe's generative AI tools, which offer similar functionalities.
- Both Veo 2 and Imagen 3 are utilized by companies like L’Oreal and Kraft Heinz to streamline content creation, reducing production time significantly.
- Google has launched its text-to-music model, Lyria, and improved its synthetic speech model, Chirp 3, to generate realistic voices and clearer transcriptions.

items.title: Why I love Twinkly Strings and Twinkly Flex
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Jess Weatherbed discovered Twinkly Strings while seeking customizable Christmas lights from a family friend's garden setup.
- Installation is user-friendly, requiring just Wi-Fi pairing, with reliable usage without frequent re-setup.
- Twinkly Strings and Flex light strips provide vibrant, customizable decor options for year-round use and are integrated with smart home routines.
- Complaints include the large power adapter plug and a desire for translucent cables for aesthetic matching.
- Recommended for anyone wanting effective and versatile lighting solutions, as the original set of Strings has lasted over five years intact.

items.title: Adobe brings 1,500 new fonts to Creative Cloud
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Adobe has launched its largest typeface expansion in five years, providing 1,500 new fonts to Creative Cloud subscribers.
- Over 750 new fonts are sourced from a collaboration with Monotype, including well-known fonts like Helvetica and Gotham.
- The update resolves issues with missing fonts and includes support for various alphabet systems used in languages such as Arabic, Chinese, and Hindi.

items.title: YouTube is supporting the ‘No Fakes Act’ targeting unauthorized AI replicas
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Senators Chris Coons and Marsha Blackburn reintroduce the NO FAKES Act to regulate AI-generated replicas of individuals' likenesses.
- YouTube supports the act, aiming to balance individual protection and innovation.
- The bill now states platforms like YouTube won't be liable for unauthorized content if they comply with removal requests and notify uploaders.
- YouTube also supports the Take It Down Act to criminalize non-consensual intimate images, including AI-generated ones.
- YouTube announces an expansion of a pilot program to help creators manage their digital likenesses, involving notable figures like MrBeast and Marques Brownlee.

items.title: Trump’s chaos is threatening the bipartisan movement to break up Big Tech
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- At Y Combinator’s Little Tech Competition Summit, a mix of optimism emerged among senators and former officials discussing competitive tech markets.
- Tensions exist regarding Trump's actions undermining regulatory agencies, complicating bipartisan efforts against Big Tech monopolies.
- Lina Khan emphasized the need for a robust government to tackle monopolies, questioning Trump's commitment to this cause amidst increased collaboration with Silicon Valley.
- Upcoming antitrust trial against Meta is highlighted, with concerns over political influence from Trump.
- The mood at the ABA’s antitrust meeting contrasted with optimism at the summit, indicating ongoing divisions in legal and regulatory approaches to antitrust issues.

items.title: Anthropic launches a $200 per month tier for “power users”
items.author: Kylie Robison

items.title: The Last of Us renewed for season 3 just ahead of HBO return
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery renewed *The Last of Us* for a third season before season 2's debut.
- Season 2 premieres on Sunday and consists of 7 episodes, shorter than the first season's 9 episodes.
- The second season is expected not to cover the entirety of *The Last of Us Part II*.
- Co-creator Craig Mazin indicated that season 3 could be larger, hinting at the possibility of a season 4.

items.title: Samsung is finally releasing Ballie
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Samsung's home robot, Ballie, will launch in the US this summer with pre-registration open on Samsung’s website.
- First announced in 2020, Ballie includes upgrades like a built-in projector, speaker, and microphone.
- The robot leverages generative AI for features such as providing style advice and optimizing a person’s smart home environment.
- Samsung has partnered with Google to enhance Ballie with Gemini multimodal reasoning, enabling it to process various inputs.
- Competing companies include Apple, Meta, and LG, all working on home robots.

items.title: These might be Microsoft’s new Office icons
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is developing new 3D icons for its Office suite, discovered through an email survey.
- The new icon design aligns with the 3D emoji style introduced in Windows 11 in 2023.
- The last redesign of Office app icons occurred in 2018, as part of a modernized look and Fluent design system.
- Microsoft is seeking user feedback on these proposed icons, although they haven't been officially released yet.

items.title: Sony adds three new wireless speakers to bass-boosted ULT Power Sound lineup
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Sony upgrades three wireless Bluetooth speakers with improved bass-boosting modes.
- New models include:
  - **ULT Tower 9**: Battery-powered with 25 hours of playback, priced at $899.99.
  - **ULT Field 5**: Priced at $329.99, offers 25 hours of battery life with enhanced LED lighting.
  - **ULT Field 3**: Costs $199.99, providing up to 24 hours of playback with a more compact design.
- All models feature a dedicated ULT shortcut button for enhanced bass modes and improved connectivity options.

items.title: Sony seems to incorporate tariff costs into new US TV prices
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Sony revealed pricing for its new Bravia 8 II OLED TV, costing $3,999.99 for the 65-inch model, which is $500 more than the A95L's starting MSRP in 2023.
- Canadian pricing remains the same at $4,999.99, suggesting US prices are adjusted due to tariffs imposed by President Trump on manufacturing hubs.
- The Bravia 5 models also show price increases in the US compared to Canadian prices when converted to USD, indicating a consistent trend in pricing strategy.

items.title: Murderbot is going through it in the first trailer for Apple's sci-fi series
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The show *Murderbot* starts streaming on May 16th, 2024.
- Features Alexander Skarsgård as the titular character, a sentient bot navigating human-like struggles.
- Based on *The Murderbot Diaries* novels by Martha Wells, it will have 10 episodes dropping on Fridays after the first two.
- Apple's growing sci-fi lineup includes *Severance*, *Silo*, and an adaptation of *Neuromancer*.

items.title: Samsung's The Frame Pro was never going to be cheap — and it isn't
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Samsung announced The Frame Pro at CES 2025 with several upgrades, including a Wireless One Connect Box and a maximum 144Hz refresh rate.
- The Frame Pro will be available in three sizes: 65-inch ($2,199), 75-inch ($3,199), and 85-inch ($4,299), with the premium over the regular 65-inch Frame ($1,799) being reasonable.
- Features include a 30-foot distance for the Wireless One Connect box, customizable bezels, and a matte anti-glare display for artwork showcasing. However, the implementation of Mini LED technology is called into question, as LEDs are only positioned at the bottom of the display.

items.title: Trump’s new tariffs leave small creators scrambling
items.author: Ash Parrish

items.title: Google Enhances The Wizard of Oz for Las Vegas Sphere using AI
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Google and Magnopus collaborate to enhance *The Wizard of Oz* for the Sphere's 160,000-square-foot screen.
- AI models, including Gemini, Veo 2, and Imagen 3, were used to increase resolution and enhance character visibility.
- New scenes allow all characters to be visible at once, improving immersion.
- Additional materials from Warner Bros. archives helped inform the AI training process.
- August 28, 2025, is the debut date for the enhanced experience, which may also feature sensory elements like heat and scents.

items.title: Trump triples tariffs on low value packages from China and Hong Kong
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Donald Trump raised the tariff rate for packages valued under $800 from China and Hong Kong, tripling previous rates.
- New tariffs are set at 90% of the package value or $75 per postal item, up from 30% or $25.
- The changes take effect on May 2nd, potentially causing delays and backlogs in shipping.

items.title: Xbox’s next major games showcase streams in June
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced the next Xbox Games Showcase will be on June 8th at 1PM ET.
- The event will feature upcoming titles from first-party studios and third-party partners.
- A second stream will focus on *The Outer Worlds 2*, releasing later this year.
- Last year's showcase included major titles like *Perfect Dark*, *Doom: The Dark Ages*, and *Starfield*.
- Major announcements expected regarding the next *Call of Duty* and other holiday games, but *Fable* has been delayed to 2026.
- The showcase precedes the Summer Game Fest on June 6th and the launch of Nintendo’s Switch 2 on June 5th, assuming no delays.

items.title: Hacking GoPros to help save the Atlantic’s rarest bird
items.author: Alexandra Marvar
items.summary:
- A young cahow, also known as the Bermuda petrel, emerges for its first flight after being assumed extinct for centuries.
- Bermudian conservationist Jeremy Madeiros hacked GoPros to create one of the world's first 24/7 livestreamed wildlife cameras to study the critically endangered cahow.
- The cahow breeding ground on Nonsuch Island now hosts upward of 186 pairs, with significant public interest and over 40 million minutes of video watched.

items.title: Google Maps is launching tools to help cities analyze infrastructure and traffic
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Google is enhancing its Google Maps Platform data access for cities and developers.
- New datasets will be integrated into BigQuery, improving data analytics capabilities.
- Tools include Imagery Insights for infrastructure condition, Roads Management Insights for traffic analysis, and Places Insights for area-specific data.
- Earth Engine’s dataset provides sustainability insights via satellite imagery.

items.title: China retaliates with additional 50 percent tariff on US goods, matching Trump’s
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- China introduces an additional 50% tariff on US goods, matching Trump's recent tariff increases.
- The new tariff follows a planned 34% charge and comes into effect on April 10th.
- China has added 12 US companies to its export control list, restricting dual-use items exports.

items.title: Universal is building a UK theme park
Framework delays Laptop 12 orders in the US over tariffs
Microsoft starts testing Copilot Vision update that can ‘see’ your screen and apps
Trump’s tariffs are officially in effect, including 104 percent on China
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Higher tariffs on imports from many countries officially went into effect today.  
- The tariffs were announced on April 2nd and were described as "reciprocal" by the White House.  
- Key tariff rates include 34% on China, 20% on the EU, and 46% on Vietnam, with total tariffs reaching 104% on Chinese imports after recent additions.  
- Higher tariffs may significantly increase costs for various goods, affecting companies like Nintendo, Jaguar Land Rover, and Micron.  
- The EU is considering its own retaliatory tariffs.  
- This is part of a broader trade strategy amid a declared national emergency regarding trade deficits.

items.title: You can grab three months of Apple TV Plus for $2.99 a month right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- New subscribers can grab Apple TV Plus for $2.99/month for the first three months until April 24th.
- The normal subscription rate is $9.99/month, resulting in a savings of $21.
- Content includes popular shows like [Severance](https://www.theverge.com/tv-reviews/633739/severance-season-2-finale-review), [Ted Lasso](https://www.theverge.com/tv-reviews/627183/the-studio-review-seth-rogen-apple), and [For All Mankind](https://www.theverge.com/2022/5/16/23075072/for-all-mankind-season-3-is-set-in-the-90s-but-seems-focused-on-a-very-2020s-space-race).
- Apple TV Plus offers ad-free access, offline downloads, and sharing with up to five family members.
- A reminder to cancel is advisable to avoid automatic renewal at the standard rate after the promotion ends.

items.title: Instagram might finally release an iPad app
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Meta is reportedly developing a dedicated Instagram app for iPad.
- Current iPad use of Instagram involves a scaled-up iPhone app, making a native app a significant upgrade.
- The push for this development comes amidst uncertainties regarding TikTok's future due to legal issues.
- Instagram's head, Adam Mosseri, previously stated the iPad app was not a priority despite public demand.
- As of 2023, the need for a native app remains, as existing formats do not fully utilize the iPad's capabilities.

items.title: Arduboy creator says his tiny Game Boy won’t survive Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Kevin Bates, creator of Arduboy, faces business challenges due to Trump's new tariffs.  
- Despite sales over $1 million, Bates claims the new 104% China tariffs threaten the viability of his company.  
- Bates explored options like raising prices or finding alternatives to production, as US manufacturers are unresponsive.  
- He declared Arduboy ‘dead’ on social media but hopes to launch a final Kickstarter for a USB-C version with more features.  
- He warns of potential customs fees for customers purchasing Arduboy products amidst the tariff issues.

items.title: Here are the best robot vacuum deals available right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums are more affordable and advanced, now featuring mopping capabilities.
- Deals available on various robot vacuums including:
  - **Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra**: $999.99 with $800 off; features include 10,000Pa suction, dual brushes, and sonic mopping.
  - **Roborock S8 Pro Ultra**: $899.99 with $700 off; lacks RGB camera, good for privacy.
  - **Roborock S8 Plus**: $549.99 with $450 off; features dual roller brushes and a vibrating mop.
  - **Roborock Q5 Pro**: $179.99 with $250 off; focuses on suction and of low price.
  - **Dreame X40 Ultra**: $899.99; offers 12,000Pa suction and features automatic cleaning and drying.
- The article includes various discounts on top-rated models and details their features and performance.

items.title: SmartThings gets Matter 1.4 support for water heaters, heat pumps, and more
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Samsung’s SmartThings platform now supports Matter 1.4, enhancing compatibility with devices like water heaters, heat pumps, and solar panels.
- The update introduces new automation triggers and a broadcast feature for connected speakers.
- Matter 1.4 allows multi-platform device usage and more granular control over devices, such as specific room cleaning for robot vacuums.
- Home Assistant is currently the only other platform with partial Matter 1.4 support, while major companies like Amazon, Apple, and Google are still lagging.
- SmartThings also enables broadcasting voice messages and automating actions based on user routines or paired devices like the Galaxy Watch.

items.title: Amazon is already changing its ultra-cheap Temu copycat
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Amazon is adjusting how it operates Amazon Haul in response to Trump's upcoming tariffs.
- New offerings include products from brands like Adidas and Levi's, moving away from the original model of very cheap unbranded items.
- Prices on Haul have increased, with items now costing over $20, unlike the previous under $20 strategy.
- New tariffs will affect imports, and Amazon's shift aims to avoid these tariffs by using US-held inventory.
- Starting May 2nd, shoppers using Haul may face additional costs due to eliminated tariff exemptions.

items.title: Predator: Killer of Killers teases a most dangerous, multigenerational game in new trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

items.title: Nintendo has already shipped ‘some’ Switch 2 inventory to the US
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nintendo has shipped a supply of Switch 2 units to the US months before the launch.
- President Doug Bowser stated that inventory is being built on a global basis.
- Nintendo hopes to meet consumer demand for the Switch 2, but its ability to do so remains uncertain.
- The console is set to launch on June 5th, following delayed preorders in the US and Canada due to tariffs.
- Analyst DFC Intelligence has reduced its sales forecast from 17 million to 15 million units for the year, still indicating rapid sales despite challenges.
- New tariffs could impact production costs as the Switch 2 is being manufactured in Vietnam, subject to a 46% tariff.

items.title: The best Bluetooth trackers for finding your stuff
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Bluetooth trackers help locate lost items by pairing with a smartphone app.
- Advanced trackers feature ultra-wideband for precision tracking and large networks for outside retrieval.
- Important features include anti-stalking mechanisms and replaceable batteries.
- Apple AirTags and Tile trackers are top recommendations, with AirTags offering precision tracking and Tile providing versatility for Android users.
- Newer standards are being developed for unwanted tracking alerts across devices.

items.title: Trump believes iPhones can be made in the US, says White House
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt claims that iPhones could be manufactured in the US as tariffs approach.
- Leavitt cited Apple's $500 billion US investment plan as a sign of their confidence in American manufacturing.
- Previous statements from Steve Jobs and Tim Cook highlight the challenge of finding a sufficient number of skilled engineers in the US to support such manufacturing.

items.title: Tesla Supercharger damaged in possible explosion in Washington
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- A Tesla Supercharger station was severely damaged in a possible explosion in Lacey, Washington.
- Local police received multiple calls about a loud noise at 1:34am PT and discovered the damaged Supercharger station upon arrival.
- The incident is being investigated as "malicious mischief" and both the Lacey Police and the FBI are involved.
- Tesla's Supercharger account has stated they are on site reviewing camera footage with law enforcement.
- This incident is part of a series of vandalism targeting Tesla vehicles and infrastructure, including acts described as "domestic terrorism" by President Donald Trump.

items.title: Trump’s DOJ will no longer prosecute cryptocurrency fraud
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is disbanding a DOJ unit focused on cryptocurrency fraud enforcement.
- Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche issued a memo halting litigation on digital asset regulations.
- The DOJ will now target individuals who defraud digital asset investors and those using cryptocurrencies for serious crimes.
- Trump's administration is dropping ongoing investigations of companies like Robinhood and Coinbase.
- This shift indicates a move towards deregulating the cryptocurrency industry under Trump's leadership.

items.title: Loss of Pulse alerts are rolling out on Pixel Watch 3
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Google starts rolling out the Loss of Pulse Detection feature for Pixel Watch 3 owners in the U.S.
- This health feature can call emergency services if a heartbeat is not detected.
- Initially announced in August last year, it was available in Europe for months before FDA clearance in late February.
- Google tested the algorithm with over 100,000 hours of data to reduce false alerts.
- Users will need to wait for a prompt on the watch to enable the feature as it rolls out over the next couple of weeks.

items.title: Amazon plays catchup with new Nova AI models to generate voices and video
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Amazon introduces Nova Sonic, a conversational voice model designed to compete with Gemini Live and OpenAI’s Advanced Voice Mode.
- Nova Sonic features real-time speech processing and a unified model architecture for a more natural tone detection and response.
- The model is accessible via Amazon’s Bedrock platform for various applications like customer service bots and AI agents in diverse industries.
- Additionally, Amazon launched Nova Reel 1.1, which improves video quality and consistency across multi-shot videos up to two minutes long.

items.title: The next season of Love, Death, and Robots is coming to Netflix this May
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

items.title: Razer pauses direct laptop sales in the US as new tariffs loom
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Razer's new Blade 16 and other laptops are no longer available for direct purchase due to impending tariffs.
- Tariffs set to take effect tonight led to the halt of sales; Razer's configurator was available as recently as April 1st.
- Other companies, including Framework and Micron, are also responding to the tariffs by halting sales or notifying customers of surcharges.
- The direct link to Blade 16's configurator now leads to a 404 error, with the website showing only a 'notify me' button for preorders.
- Razer has not commented on the impact of tariffs but has paused direct sales on its US site.

items.title: Trump will hit China with 104 percent tariffs
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- The US will impose a cumulative 104 percent tariff on goods imported from China, confirmed by the White House.
- This is part of President Trump's trade war, aimed at equality in trade and bringing jobs back to the US, but critics warn it may harm consumers and businesses.
- Trump's initial tariff plan was for 34 percent; this escalation follows China's own imposed tariffs on US goods.

items.title: The kid-friendly Fitbit Ace has returned to its best price to date
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Fitbit Ace LTE is currently priced at $149.95, a $30 discount from its normal price.
- It is designed to engage kids in exercise through games and features like calling and texting preselected contacts.
- The watch requires an Ace Pass for LTE features at $9.99 a month and has parental controls for safety.
